      Method which checks whether a string which is having many values separated by a delimiter contains a particular value or not If the compositeStr is "QC, ATT, L3" & strToBeSearched is "QC" & regex is "," then the method will return true.

      • makeFormattedString

        public static java.lang.String makeFormattedString(java.lang.String aAttrName,
                                                   java.lang.Object aObj,
                                                   boolean aPrependSeparator)
        Utility method that gets formatted string representing the Object.

        For String object it returns "string_value". For other objects it returns [obj.toString()]. If the object is null then it returns null.

        Example: aAttrName="aObj",aAttrName="aObj", etc, where the "," is controlled using the aPrependSeparator set to true.

        Parameters:
        aAttrName - A String attribute name
        aObj - An Object value.
        aPrependSeparator - A boolean value used in PreFormatString(String, boolean) to append a "," before the aAttrName value.
        Returns:
        A String - formatted string
        See Also:
        PreFormatString(String, boolean)

      • makeFormattedString

        public static java.lang.String makeFormattedString(java.lang.String aAttrName,
                                                   int aInt,
                                                   boolean aPrependSeparator)
        Utility method that gets formatted string representing a int.

        Example: aAttrName="String.valueOf(aInt)",aAttrName="String.valueOf(aInt)", etc, where the "," is controlled using the aPrependSeparator set to true.

        Parameters:
        aAttrName - A String attribute name value.
        aInt - An integer value.
        aPrependSeparator - A boolean value used in PreFormatString(String, boolean) to append a "," before the aAttrName value.
        Returns:
        A formatted String.
        See Also:
        PreFormatString(String, boolean)

      • makeFormattedString

        public static java.lang.String makeFormattedString(java.lang.String aAttrName,
                                                   char aChar,
                                                   boolean aPrependSeparator)
        Utility method that gets formatted string representing a char. The returned string has sinqle quotes(') arround the char.

        Example: aAttrName="'String.valueOf((char)aChar)'",aAttrName="'String.valueOf((char)aChar)'", etc, where the "," is controlled using the aPrependSeparator set to true.

        Parameters:
        aAttrName - String attribute name
        aChar - A char value
        aPrependSeparator - A boolean value used in PreFormatString(String, boolean) to append a "," before the aAttrName value.
        Returns:
        String - formatted string
        See Also:
        PreFormatString(String, boolean)

        public static java.lang.String makeFormattedString(java.lang.String aAttrName,
                                                   java.lang.Object[] anObjArray,
                                                   boolean aPrependSeparator)
        Utility method that formats array of Object.

        Example: aAttrName[]="[LENGTH=anObjArray.length(anObjArray{i}, ... ]", where the "," is controlled using the aPrependSeparator set to true.

        Parameters:

        anObjArray - An Object array of values

        A formatted String.

      • Replace

        public static java.lang.String Replace(java.lang.String aSrcStr,
                                       java.lang.String aSearchStr,
                                       java.lang.String aReplaceStr)
        Replaces the 'search string' with 'replace string' in a given 'source string'
        Parameters:
        aSrcStr - A source String value.
        aSearchStr - A String value to be searched for in the source String.
        aReplaceStr - A String value that replaces the search String.
        Returns:
        A String with the 'search string' replaced by 'replace string'.

      • parseString

        public static java.lang.String parseString(java.lang.String inputStr,
                                           char startingChar,
                                           char endingChar,
                                           java.lang.String key)
        Method which parses the input String to send back the value corresponding to the input key. For eg: If the inputStr is "TradingPartnerKey=5; OWNER=L3; CBTN=3036240004; RTI=105" startingChar is '=', endingChar = ';' & key = "TradingPartnerKey" Then the response String will be "5"
        Parameters:
        inputStr - The input String to be parsed
        startingChar - The first character to be found after the input key
        endingChar - The first character to be found after the input key-value pair
        key - For which you need to extract the value
        Returns:

      • isContainedIn

        public static boolean isContainedIn(java.lang.String strToBeSearched,
                                    java.lang.String compositeStr,
                                    java.lang.String regex)
        Method which checks whether a string which is having many values separated by a delimiter contains a particular value or not If the compositeStr is "QC, ATT, L3" & strToBeSearched is "QC" & regex is "," then the method will return true.
        Parameters:
        strToBeSearched - the value which needs to be searched for in the composite String
        compositeStr - the String which contains all the values separated by a delimiter
        regex - the delimiting regular expression
        Returns:
